summary: This is an email from attorney Marc A. Weinstein to Andrew Tomback, responding to grand jury subpoenas issued to the executors of Jeffrey Epstein's estate. The email transmits trust documents and asserts privilege over communications and drafts related to the trusts, while deferring production of non-privileged materials.

persons.name: Marc A. Weinstein
persons.context: Partner at Hughes Hubbard & Reed LLP who is responding to grand jury subpoenas on behalf of the executors of Jeffrey Epstein's estate, asserting privilege over certain documents.

persons.name: Andrew Tomback
persons.context: Addressee of the email regarding the grand jury subpoena response; likely a government attorney or involved party.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased individual whose estate and trusts are the subject of the grand jury subpoenas.

connections.description: Weinstein is acting as legal counsel for the executors of Epstein's estate, representing the estate's interests in response to grand jury subpoenas.
Weinstein is communicating with Tomback regarding the subpoena response, indicating a professional legal interaction.

events.title: Grand jury subpoenas issued
events.description: Grand jury subpoenas were issued to the executors of Jeffrey Epstein's estate, requesting trust documents, drafts, notes, and communications.

events.title: Subpoena response submitted
events.description: Marc A. Weinstein responds to the grand jury subpoenas, providing some trust documents but asserting privilege over communications and drafts, and agreeing to defer production.

locations: One Battery Park Plaza, 17th floor, New York, NY 10004-1482
keyFacts: Grand jury subpoenas were issued on October 18, 2019, to the executors of Jeffrey Epstein's estate seeking trust documents and related communications.

Three trust documents were produced: 'The 1953 Trust' (dated August 8, 2019), 'Amended and Restated Jeffrey E. Epstein 2019 Trust' (dated February 4, 2019), and 'Jeffrey E. Epstein 2019 Trust' (dated January 18, 2019).
The estate's attorney, Marc A. Weinstein, asserts that most communications related to the trust formation are privileged and defers production of non-privileged documents.
The government is noted to be in possession of some potential sources of information, such as Mr. Epstein's computers.
The correspondence indicates ongoing legal proceedings and investigation into Epstein's estate and financial structures following his death.
